metadata.dc:author: Mercé, J
Evangelista, A
García del Castillo, H
Soler Soler, J
Sagristà, J
metadata.dc:description: Transesophageal echocardiography is a very useful technique in studying thoracic aorta diseases, particularly aortic dissection and aortic intramural hematoma. In this report, we describe a case of aortic intramural hematoma after balloon angioplasty of a recoarctation. This case illustrates the importance of transesophageal echocardiography in the diagnosis and subsequent management of possible complications following this technique.
metadata.dc:title: Utilidad de la ecocardiografía transesofágica en el diagnóstico de un hematoma aórtico tras la angioplastia de una recoartación aórtica.
[The use of transesophageal echocardiography in the diagnosis of aortic hematoma after an aortic recoarctation angioplasty].
